column1: The Council is committed to providing a wide range of services to local businesses and the community at large. The Council's Economic Development Unit plays a key role in encouraging investment in the Borough. The Unit is also working to increase the quality and variety of skills offered to Tameside residents, helping them to make the most of new employment and training opportunities as they are created.
Much of the business advice available for businesses is delivered through partnerships.
If you are thinking of starting a Business

New businesses can access business advice and training from R. Stuart Ridgway Associates Ltd. Enterprise Centre, Oldham Street, Hyde. For an appointment Tel. 0161 368 3122 or e-mail admin@ridgway-associates.co.uk or visit www.ridgway-associates.co.uk .
If you are considering starting a social enterprise or community business, advice is available from the Council's Social Enterprise project team.
You may need to contact the HM Revenue and Customs regarding tax and National Insurance contributions.
See below for other information that may assist you including business information, grants and property.

If your business employs less than 10 people your first stop should be R Stuart Ridgway Associates, who operate Ridgways Enterprise Centre in Hyde, for the Small Business Service. For more information on subsidised assistance e-mail admin@ridgway-associates.co.uk or visit www.ridgway-associates.co.uk

If your business employs more than 10 people or is in a high growth or new technology field, or for advice on exporting, contact the Small Business Service franchise for the area - this is Chamber link on 0161 237 4000 or visit www.tvc.org.uk .
You can arrange a visit from one of Tameside Council's Business Outreach Officers to guide you through the services on offer.
If your business is within the Cultural Industries (i.e. design, new media, photography, music, fashion, film, arts etc) you may find additional information from www.cids.co.uk
If your business is experiencing financial difficulty, Manchester Business Debtline Services are available free of charge. They can be contacted at the Chamber Business Enterprise on 0161 237 4000.
Information is available for businesses receiving letters from Data Protection Agencies.
Other useful Information available from the Council includes:
Development Opportunities available within the Borough
A number of key development sites exist within the Borough including Ashton Moss, these can be seen at www.tameside.gov.uk/business/property.htm and www.tamesidem60.com .

The Council and other bodies such as the Department for Trade and Industry are able to offer grants when funding allows. However, these schemes are discretionary and may have restricted eligibility. For information on current schemes please complete the on-line Grant Enquiry Form.

For details of privately owned business properties (including industrial, office retail, land and development opportunities) currently available in the Tameside area, please contact the Economic Development Unit on 0161 342 2865/2167 or Send a Message to Inward Investment or complete the on-line Business Property Enquiry Form.
The Council has a selection of properties and land for sale in addition to shops and industrial units to let.

Planning holds a balance between the need for new development and the need to protect the environment and tries to ensure all development is environmentally sustainable. Construction methods also need to comply with the Building Regulations for which there is a separate set of approvals.
There are also separate approvals governing the display of outdoor advertisements, developments affecting Listed Buildings and the demolition of unlisted buildings in Conservation areas.

Many businesses require a licence e.g. hairdressers, pet shops and places of public entertainment. Appropriate advice and guidance is available covering all aspects of trading, licensing and public health legislation.
The values of all property in respect of which rates are payable to the Council are shown in the local ratings list. More information about business rates.
The Trade Waste Service is available to all commercial and industrial premises in the Borough. The Council also carries out commercial Pest Control work for local businesses.

The Council is committed to attracting new jobs to the area and works in partnership with other agencies to ensure residents benefit from employment opportunities created within the Borough. Send a Message to Employment and Training Initiatives.

The e-tameside business service support project aims to encourage businesses to utilise new information and communication technologies such as e-mail, the world wide web and e-commerce. Specialist business advisors offer advice to local businesses. The team can help draw up specifications for web site design and give details of local training providers and web site designers.

Tameside Business Environment Association (TBEA) is a business support organisation funded through Europe and supported by the council. The aim of TBEA is to provide help and support to Tameside companies looking to improve any aspect of their environmental performance and particularly focuses on cost saving measures that bring both environmental improvements and business benefits. Other services available through TBEA are the Business Environmental Mentoring Network which aims to co-ordinate the sharing of environmental expertise between businesses that have already established good environmental practises and those that want to improve their environmental performance. TBEA also offers access to a Small Business Travel Co-ordinator offering companies advice on ways in which they can reduce their transport costs by implementing cost saving, environmentally friendly measures such as travel plans, and sourcing grants for fuel conversions. For more information contact TBEA:
0161 342 2885 or Send a Message to TBEA
Business Information from Tameside's library service

Looking for somewhere to research the business you're thinking of starting, find tips on writing your business plan or access a PC with an office package? Then why not visit the Tameside Libraries Information Service

Tameside MBC is working to increase awareness of the opportunity to develop trade links with China, by building on its strong civic link with Bengbu, in the Anhui province. Working in partnership with Chamber Link , China Link , Trade Partners UK and the China Britain Business Council Tameside MBC may provide local companies with the opportunity to connect with overseas partners. For further information Send us a Message.
A-Z of Council Services for Business

A new edition of this handy guide covering all Council services to businesses is now available. For further information please contact 0161 342 2167 or Send us a Message about A-Z of Council Services .
View the Resource Guide for Small Businesses.
Still not found what you are looking for? Try our Search or our A to Z of Services:
